ratings.rComments: Stelzer is awesome! I thought the class was well organized and very reasonably graded. Lots of cool material, useful lectures, neat demos! He really cares about the class so it doesn't feel so impersonal in such a huge lecture.

I thought the class was pretty difficult, but honestly so many people have so many differing opinions on it that it can go any way for you. You either think its easy, or you really have to work for a good grade. Stelzer himself is the man - hilarious, good presenter, makes plenty of connections to applications, awesome demos. Lots of fun!
awesome professor
Funny professor, and he teaches great.
Amazing professor, clears all the concepts very well in class and a plus point he is really funny

This class was hard. If you are good at physics, you should be okay. However, the teaching method used wasn't helpful. Professor seemed to care for students but I found this class confusing and annoying. I've taken four physics classes at UIUC, so far they have been pretty dull, boring and confusing. Department should probably change things up.

Amazing lecturer and very good at answering questions even though he does it with a very subtle sarcastic attitude that is humorous if you catch it.  Uses lots of good props and in class examples to show how the physics works.  Tests are tough but you have a pretty clear idea of what you are about to get into from the practice exams.
Don't take physics here- hard and boring. Professor was decent at explaining, pretty good at office hours but that doesn't make up for the way the class was comprised.

I personally didn't like this class, tests were hard but the homework was doable. If you give this class time, you could do well. However, having taken several physics classes here with a similar teaching method, you'll end up struggling. Wouldn't recommend unless you have to take this class.

Class was hard. Didn't like the way the class was taught, but there was some easy grades like labs. However, I found myself lost a lot of the time, tests were unfair at times. The physics classes I've taken here so far have been questionable to say the least. Get a tutor or don't take physics at this school

Don't take this class. In fact, avoid physics at UIUC, they don't know what they are doing. Tests are unnecessarily hard, labs tedious, homework unhelpful and lectures boring. This department needs reworking asap. Take this class at a community college.
Nice guy, but can't teach. Class was a mess, most people taught themselves physics. A lot of complaints about the physics department/program this year. Can't say I'm surprised. Buyer beware.

This dude is the bomb.  The lectures are a lot like what you got from 211, but his delivery is really clear and he's a really charming professor.  The course itself is a natural progression in difficulty from 211, so no big deal there.  At least for 211 and 212 so far, the physics department really has it together.

Decent guy, but can't teach. Lectures were extremely boring and unhelpful if not confusing. The midterms and final were very hard. Prelectures/checkpoints are useless, lectures were confusing, and homework hard. Ended up teaching myself. The UIUC physics department should be very disappointed; the physics program itself has been a let down.
Lectures were boring and he often confused himself. Homework took forever, tests are doable, some hard.
One of my all time favorites
Best prof I've had in the physics department. He's great at explaining things and is really funny.

His lectures are typically clear and somewhat helpful. Most of the learning is done through smartphysics, but he often can clear up confusing topics in lecture. He is genuinely interested in his students despite the fact that it is a large lecture and will respond to your needs if you have questions or any problems.
He is very enthusiastic about teaching, always make sure you understand the materials. He made physics easy for us, I felt sooooo lucky to have him as my phys212 professor.
Great teacher, very clear about everything and spends the first 5 minutes of class trying to clear up confusion with the material.

Super funny guy, i love him. Good teacher too. He actually knows how to teach. In lecture, there might be some things you dont completely understand, but if you go to him afterwards, he will be great at explaining it face to face. Real tough course but hes a super helpful guy. You gotta study hard, hrs of homework, and ask him questions after class
If you attend lectures and actually put in effort the class isn't too hard. He's interactive in his lectures, and makes jokes. He genuinely wants to help and is able to do so effectively.

His lectures were pretty interesting. He tried to ensure that everyone understood the material. He always thanked his students for asking questions, and I liked that. He also made jokes which I personally thought were very funny. Exams were fairly easy. Labs were extremely tedious, but that's not his fault. Attend his lectures if possible!

Great professor.  I would recommend him over all other lecturers for this class.  He is nice and really goes out of his way to make sure students understand.  Exams are very thorough but pretty straight forward.
Funny, entertaining and super helpful. Highly recommend him.

He is probably the best professor I have ever met. Super awesome guy. I had credit for PHYS212 before the class but he was too good so I didn't drop it. Lectures are engaging and well-organized. Exams difficulty are just right. Homework and pre-lectures are pretty helpful, discussion too. Labs were annoying, but all labs are annoying so whatever.

He was an amazing teacher, with dry humor, and fantastic demos. He really made the lectures interesting; they just flew by. So great!! And his grading is fair, and his iclicker bonus points save you a whole lot!

Without a doubt the best professor I have had thus far. Makes very difficult material easy somehow. The work he and his colleagues have done with physics education is incredible and absolutely works. I would certainly gotten a worse grade in E&M with a less talented professor. Highest recommendations for Stelzer.

Tim Stelzer is great! He is funny, does cool demos, loves to teach, and likes talking to people. Phys 212 can be a little rough for some people because there's more "imagination" involved, but like other Physics courses here, if you do the practice exams you should be fine.
Great professor.  Highly recommend him.  Makes lecture fun. Demos are cool and he makes jokes during class.

Great techer, you can tell he actually cares about his students. The only thing is that he makes things seem so easy in class and it can be frustrating when you're doing things on your own that you realize are actually hard.

TRULY OUTSTANDING!! He is so funny and really gets a lot across to you. Not a single complaint. Quizzes is what got me, stay on it. Demos really shine. Highly recommend Stelzer, I also had Mats for a few times and he is also super good. Cannot go wrong.

This guy is really cool and you can tell he wants his students to learn, however he also makes a lot of comments about how easy and simple the stuff is even though I struggle with it a lot which is really frustrating.  Go to his office hours and introduce yourself if you're having trouble and he'll try to help.

He's soooo much fun! Humor and teaching mixed to perfection. This class is hard because of the exams, so theres nothing you can do about that, but if you have to take it, you'll learn the most from him!

Stelzer was a really great teacher, very interesting and a good lecturer. However, I didnt anticipate HOW INCREDIBLY TOUGH the tests would be and I completely FAILED the first one. But with enough work and effort I was able to end up with a B in the class (thank goodness). A lot of work altogether, so keep up on it or you will suffer.

Stelzer is a really funny guy who is also pretty brilliant.  Great at teaching and explaining, exams weren't too bad either.  Lectures are the bomb since he always has some sort of sweet demo and has the class laughing with his physics jokes. I would highly recommend him.
Great professor, knows what he is talking about and does cool demos.

Great professor. Great sense of humor, charismatic, makes class fun. Required you to "get to know" your neighbor. He often went in the nosebleed section and chatted with students before class. Great taste in music. You can tell physics is his passion. He's a great dynamic teacher, always striving to help and doesn't put you to sleep.

Great guy. Likes to joke around. Explained things well. Exams were difficult. I'm probably biased since I don't like physics but if I were to choose a professor to teach me physics it would be him. I see him riding his bike around campus all the time :)
Really good at explaining the material and keeping your attention, really funny and down to earth guy.  Class was easy to sit through and funny.

He is hilarious! I really enjoyed going to lecture because I knew he'd be entertaining every day. He's also a very good professor in that he is passionate about his subject. The class is tough, but get him for lecture if you can.

practice exams definitely help on the hour exams. He is better than the other phys 211 lecturer so get him if you can. he does so many fun demos and has good jokes! however, if you're not a physics person, you def. need to study harder to get an A.

Very clear and passionate about physics.  This is a true american professor who knows what he is talking about and wants to share his knowledge with others.  I have never had a more interesting professor.

T-Dawg is awesome! Very entertaining and great at teaching. Normally it sucks when some of your grade is based on attending class, but his lectures are the bomb so it doesn't matter. I recommend him to anyone. Thanks for a great semester Stelzer!
Amazing, fun, helpful, awesome, easy

Great professor. He is very funny in class, which makes his lecture great to attend. The material is kinda tough at times, but the exams are very fair. There are many years of practice exams online, and if you do all of those, getting at least a B will be VERY EASY.

Stelzer is a great teacher and one of the funniest professors you'll have, but I don't have a physics kind of mind, and the class was just insanely difficult for me. Homework would take hours, and the tests were very difficult. Since there's not textbook, you're really going to have to do the practice exam questions in preparation for the tests.
T-dawg is the man! He's definitely one of the best professors in the physics dept. He can somehow make you excited and learn about physics. He genuinely seems to want you to learn. He's awesome.

The professor is fantastic. He makes every lecture fun and interesting, however the class is HARD, especially if you didn't have a decent physics class in high school. Exams are tough and there's NO CURVE. Labs however are pretty straight forward and are a good grade booster. Homework can be tough but its doable.
Awesome lecturer. He keeps you interested with demonstrations and humor. The class is difficult but he does an excellent job explaining concepts and giving examples.
Great lecturer, explains well, keeps you interested, pretty normal guy. Also, he has a funny subtle humor.
Amusing lecturer. There's no reason to avoid this professor.
Great prof for 101, not so good for 212.

Great lecturer, quick to reply with emails and is very helpful. Makes great jokes. Tests are pretty easy if you go to discussion section and understand/do well on the quizzes. Do the homework yourself or you will fall behind.
Very fun and entertaining.  Class is fair.
Stelzer was a really good professor... his tests were extremely hard for me, but lectures were interesting because of demos.  And he gives out cookies.
Totally disconnected from class outside of lecture, TAs do everything and make impossible quizzes. Weekly difficult online homework, class is not curved.
Best Professor.  Going to class is enjoyable and he is very helpful.  Try hard at discussion, work on homework, attend class- you'll do fine!
I can't say enough good things about this guy.  This was the first class I've actually looked forward to going to here.
Hilarious, best lecturer I have ever had. Tests are somewhat difficult though.
Easy class but lot of work. Go to class, have a good time, work in discussions, do your hw, go to lab, and you'll get an A- easily.

I LOVE PROFESSOR STELZER!!!  He is an amazing teacher and he makes me laugh every time I go to class.  He explains things very clearly.  He is so funny and I would probably marry him if he wasn't 20 years older than me because he's so funny.  HAHA.  Just kidding.  But he is awesome!
Amazing, enthusiastic, helpful, hilarious, easy going, makes physics the most fun class EVER
Without a doubt, the best professor I have EVER had!  His is honestly the only lecture I have ever tried to make it to.
he's awesome! really nice , fun and sweet, and very approachable when you need help. tests are hard though, but that's to be expected. he rocks for giving out cookies in lecture! :)
He was my fav teacher.  Very nice, Very funny, and never made you feel dumb for asking questions.
Lecture was like pulling teeth.  Did well in class and missed next grade cutoff by 2 points...The guy won't review my stuff or give me a chance to get those 2 points, what BS
Absolute best teacher I have had at Illinois.  Even makes people want to go to class.  No other prof can do that for me.  Should teach 102 also.
Great teacher, makes class fun.  It's Phys101, so not that easy for some
Funny, nice guy - makes class fun to go to
nice and funny professor, interesting class (always has demonstrations to show)
great class
No Comments
No Comments
Good job, highly recommend
